channel.title: My first bit of python
channel.description:
i decided that i needed to at least year some of the basics of python before i started classes to make it easier to understand what they where talking about. i was learning from code academy and reading over mit's free courses on there website. A gentle introduction to programming in python.
Anyways here is what i got after 2 days of just learning basic things i would like to know if i done it correctly and if you have any other way of doing it that makes the code cleaner or better explain away.
Here is what i made.
[code] # Questions.py Version One # Date. 11.10.2013 At 4:48 EST
# variables to explain the date and username of my moparscape acouant date = str(2008)
# what is your name with the variable name name = raw_input('what is your name ')
# it prints out the phrase 'hello thanks for joining me with the variable name print 'Hello thanks for joining me ' + name
# have you heard of moparscape with another variable. using a simple yes or no moparscape = raw_input('have you heard about moparscape ')
# it prints out the response to the users input print moparscape + ' oh wow you have never heard of moparscape? its the best rsps community'
# yet another raw_input with a question creation = raw_input('how long have you been around moparscape? ')
# print with the date print 'I have been around since ' + date
#say goodbye i love you moparscape print 'I hope you stick around moparscape is a great place'[/code]

item.title: My first bit of python
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

you don’t really check for the answers. I also think you should update. print is now a function and not a statement.

but kudos for trying and good luck learning!

Read full topic

item.title: My first bit of python
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:3, topic:535415”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=654224.msg4382478#msg4382478 date=1384043301]
Looking good mate, keep up the good work. Glad to see you learning new languages rather than the tired old JavaScript.
[/quote]Python’s older than JavaScript.[/quote]I meant new to OP, not new in general.

Read full topic

item.title: My first bit of python
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:3, topic:535415”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=654224.msg4382478#msg4382478 date=1384043301]
Looking good mate, keep up the good work. Glad to see you learning new languages rather than the tired old JavaScript.
[/quote]Python’s older than JavaScript.[/quote]And both languages have much relevance and are very powerful languages.

# yet another raw_input with a question creation = raw_input('how long have you been around moparscape? ')
Just to be picky, since you don’t use the answer for this in anything, you don’t have to store it in a variable, you may just call the method.
But just bein’ picky. Keep it up!

Read full topic

item.title: My first bit of python
item.dc:creator: @D3i7y D3i7y
item.description:
@D3i7y wrote:

i went with python because its a good place to start. i did consider C++ and java but i have never understood how to program most of the people i talked to said python was a good place to start and i saw a few posts on google saying start with BASIC and Pascal but i cant do much with them… so this is why i went with python as my first language.

Read full topic

item.title: My first bit of python
item.dc:creator: @D3i7y D3i7y
item.description:
@D3i7y wrote:

i decided that i needed to at least year some of the basics of python before i started classes to make it easier to understand what they where talking about. i was learning from code academy and reading over mit’s free courses on there website. A gentle introduction to programming in python.

Anyways here is what i got after 2 days of just learning basic things i would like to know if i done it correctly and if you have any other way of doing it that makes the code cleaner or better explain away.

Here is what i made.

[code]

Questions.py Version One

Date. 11.10.2013 At 4:48 EST

variables to explain the date and username of my moparscape acouant

date = str(2008)

what is your name with the variable name

name = raw_input('what is your name ')

it prints out the phrase 'hello thanks for joining me with the variable name

print 'Hello thanks for joining me ’ + name

have you heard of moparscape with another variable. using a simple yes or no

moparscape = raw_input('have you heard about moparscape ')

it prints out the response to the users input

print moparscape + ’ oh wow you have never heard of moparscape? its the best rsps community’

yet another raw_input with a question

creation = raw_input('how long have you been around moparscape? ')

print with the date

print 'I have been around since ’ + date

#say goodbye i love you moparscape
print ‘I hope you stick around moparscape is a great place’[/code]
